Dense yet breathable. Serious yet modern.
<subtext>Exactly what you expect from a professional tool.</subtext>

features.title: What QoreDB does <accent>well</accent>

unified.title: Unified SQL + NoSQL
unified.desc: PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB in a single coherent interface.

vault.title: Security & Privacy
vault.desc: Encrypted credentials (Argon2) and GDPR compliant (zero telemetry).

ssh.title: SSH Tunneling
ssh.desc: Native support for SSH tunnels for remote databases.

library.title: Query Library
library.desc: Query library with folders, tags, and export.

envs.title: Environment Protection
envs.desc: Distinct Dev/Staging/Prod, mutation blocking in prod.

compatibility.coming_soon: SQLite, Redis and more coming soon...

why.description: DBeaver, phpMyAdmin, pgAdmin... They do the job, but the UX is mediocre, workflows are poorly optimized and they haven't evolved with the modern way of working.

roadmap_page.title: QoreDB Roadmap
roadmap_page.subtitle: Discover the next steps in QoreDB development.

now.title: Now — Solid Foundations
now.quote: Make QoreDB reliable, fast, and pleasant for daily use.

items.1: Continuous improvement of performance and stability
items.3: Smoother user experience on existing workflows
items.5: Documentation and progressive opening to the community

now.goal: Goal: a tool that developers can use and recommend with confidence.

soon.title: Soon — Productivity and Clarity

items.1: More efficient data navigation and exploration
items.2: Better understanding of structures and relationships
items.3: Safer and more intuitive data editing

soon.goal: Goal: save developers real time, every day.

later.title: Later — The QoreDB Vision
later.quote: Rethink how developers interact with their data.
later.goal: Goal: become the reference tool for modern developers.

transparency.text: This roadmap reflects the current direction of the project. It is subject to evolve based on community feedback and real-world usage.

what_is_qoredb.question: What exactly is QoreDB?
what_is_qoredb.answer:
QoreDB is a **modern, open-source, local-first database client**, designed for developers who want to work efficiently with SQL and NoSQL databases, without depending on an imposed cloud.

It focuses on:

* **performance**,
* **security**,
* a **polished developer experience**,
* and a long-term vision more ambitious than traditional tools.

difference_dbeaver.question: How is QoreDB different from DBeaver or existing tools?
difference_dbeaver.answer:
QoreDB does not seek to be a "feature-by-feature" alternative.

Key differences:

* **Local-first** architecture (no data sent by default)
* Built-in security and guardrails (environments, read-only, production rules)
* User experience designed for speed and clarity
* Unified SQL + NoSQL vision
* Modern, extensible, long-term oriented codebase

QoreDB is designed as a **daily work tool**, not an "aging Swiss Army knife".

is_opensource.question: Is QoreDB really open-source?
is_opensource.answer:
Yes.

The core of QoreDB is **open-source**, readable, auditable, and modifiable.
Transparency is part of the project's DNA.

Eventually, some advanced features may exist as a paid offering, **without ever removing essential capabilities from the open-source version**.

is_free.question: Is QoreDB free?
is_free.answer:
Yes.

QoreDB is **free to download and use**, on macOS, Windows, and Linux.

A paid offer may exist in the future for advanced or professional uses, but the core of the product will remain free and usable without cost.

data_privacy.question: Is my data sent anywhere?
data_privacy.answer:
No.

By default:

* Connections, queries, and data remain **strictly local**.
* No database is proxied or stored on a remote server.

Measurement tools (analytics) are:

* **disabled by default**
* **anonymous**
* **explicit opt-in**

QoreDB adopts a **privacy-first** philosophy.

analytics.question: Do you use analytics tools?
analytics.answer:
Yes, but with strict rules.

Analytics serve only to:

* understand feature adoption,
* improve user experience,
* prioritize developments.

They **never** collect:

* database data,
* complete SQL queries,
* credentials,
* sensitive content.

Activation is always **voluntary**.

production_ready.question: Is QoreDB suitable for production use?
production_ready.answer:
Yes, with guardrails.

QoreDB integrates:

* environments (dev / staging / prod),
* a read-only mode,
* protections against dangerous queries,
* cancellation and timeout mechanisms.

The goal is to reduce **human errors**, without slowing down developers.

supported_databases.question: Which databases are supported?
supported_databases.answer:
QoreDB currently supports:

* PostgreSQL
* MySQL / MariaDB
* MongoDB

Other engines are planned as the architecture evolves.

remote_ssh.question: Does it work with remote connections and SSH?
remote_ssh.answer:
Yes.

QoreDB supports:

* classic remote connections,
* SSH tunnels,
* different authentication modes depending on the databases.

Connection security is a priority.

platforms.question: On which systems is QoreDB available?
platforms.answer:
QoreDB is available on:

* macOS
* Windows
* Linux

Builds are updated regularly.

maintenance.question: Is the project actively maintained?
maintenance.answer:
Yes.

QoreDB is in active development, with:

* frequent releases,
* structural refactors,
* a public roadmap,
* gradual opening to the community.

The project has already passed its POC stage.

contribute.question: Can I contribute to the project?
contribute.answer:
Yes, and it is encouraged.

Possible contributions:

* user feedback,
* GitHub issues and discussions,
* improvement proposals,
* code and documentation.

A community GitHub is being structured.

pro_version.question: Will there be a "Pro" version?
pro_version.answer:
Probably, yes.

The goal is not to block usage, but to offer:

* advanced features,
* collaborative or professional uses,
* options intended for teams and companies.

The open-source version will remain fully usable.

funding.question: How will the project be funded?
funding.answer:
The targeted model is:

* sustainable open-source,
* self-funded,
* without dependence on a mandatory centralized cloud.

Details will evolve with product adoption.

professional_use.question: Can I use QoreDB in a professional setting?
professional_use.answer:
Yes.

QoreDB is designed to be used:

* by solo developers,
* early startups,
* technical teams.

Security, stability, and maintenance aspects are taken seriously.

follow_progress.question: Where can I follow the project's evolution?
follow_progress.answer:
* On the official website
* Via the public roadmap
* On LinkedIn (regular sharing of project progress)
* On GitHub

join_beta.question: How to join the beta or test QoreDB?
join_beta.answer:
QoreDB is already available for download.

You can:

* install it directly,
* join the beta via the site,
* share your feedback to influence the future of the project.

long_term.question: Can I trust QoreDB in the long term?
long_term.answer:
QoreDB is designed as a **long-term project**, not an experiment.

Technical, product, and open-source choices go in the direction of:

* sustainability,
* transparency,
* developer trust.

intro.title: 1. Data Controller
intro.content:
The data controller is the editor of the QoreDB project.

Complete information regarding the legal entity will be specified as soon as the legal structure is finalized.

data_collection.title: 2. Data Collection
data_collection.content:
QoreDB strictly limits the collection of personal data.

2.1 Navigation Data (Website)

When consulting the site, anonymized technical data may be collected for statistical purposes, including:

  • pages visited,
  • device type and browser,
  • operating system,
  • approximate country or geographic area,
  • load times and performance.

This data does not allow for the personal identification of a user.

QoreDB uses Vercel Analytics, a privacy-respecting analytics solution:

  • no cookies,
  • no cross-site tracking,
  • no advertising profiling.

2.2 Voluntarily Provided Data

Certain data may be voluntarily provided by the user, for example:

  • during contact,
  • during registration for a newsletter,
  • during the use of future services requiring authentication.

Collected data may include:

  • email address,
  • name or pseudonym,
  • message content.

purposes.title: 3. Purposes of Processing
purposes.content:
Collected data is used solely to:

  • ensure the proper functioning of the site and services,
  • improve performance and user experience,
  • respond to contact requests,
  • communicate information related to the QoreDB project.

No personal data is sold, rented, or ceded to third parties for commercial purposes.

legal_basis.title: 4. Legal Basis for Processing
legal_basis.content:
Personal data processing is based on:

  • QoreDB's legitimate interest (anonymous statistics, security),
  • the user's explicit consent when required,
  • the execution of a request initiated by the user.

cookies.title: 5. Cookies and Trackers
cookies.content:
QoreDB does not use advertising or behavioral tracking cookies.

The analytical tools used do not require prior consent in accordance with applicable regulations.

Should cookies be used in the future, this policy would be updated and a consent mechanism would be implemented.

hosting.title: 6. Hosting and Sub-processors
hosting.content:
The QoreDB site and services are hosted by providers respecting high standards of security and compliance.

Data may be processed on servers located in the European Union or in countries offering an adequate level of protection in accordance with the GDPR.

security.title: 7. Data Security
security.content:
QoreDB implements appropriate technical and organizational measures to guarantee the security, integrity, and confidentiality of data, including:

  • encryption of communications,
  • access control,
  • monitoring and limitation of unauthorized access.

retention.title: 8. Retention Period
retention.content:
Personal data is retained only for the duration necessary for the purposes for which it was collected.

Anonymized statistical data may be kept without time limitation.

rights.title: 9. User Rights
rights.content:
In accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), users have the following rights:

  • right of access,
  • right of rectification,
  • right to erasure,
  • right to restriction of processing,
  • right to object,
  • right to data portability.

Any request can be made via the contact means indicated on the site.

third_party.title: 10. Links to Third-Party Services
third_party.content: The QoreDB site may contain links to third-party services (e.g., GitHub). QoreDB is not responsible for the privacy policies applied by these services.

changes.title: 11. Policy Changes
changes.content:
QoreDB reserves the right to modify this Privacy Policy at any time.

Users are invited to consult it regularly. The date of the last update is indicated at the top of the page.

contact.title: 12. Contact
contact.content: For any questions regarding personal data protection, you can contact the QoreDB team via the official channels indicated on the site.

editor.title: Site Editor
editor.content:
**Project Name / Product:** QoreDB
**Publication Director:** Raphaël Plassart
**Status:** Software Project (open-core)

> Information regarding the legal entity (company name, legal form, address, registration number) will be specified as soon as the legal structure is finalized.

hosting.title: Hosting
hosting.content:
The QoreDB website is hosted by **Vercel Inc.**, located at 340 S Lemon Ave #4133 Walnut, CA 91789, USA.

Data may be hosted on infrastructures located within the European Union or in countries offering a level of data protection compliant with current regulations.

ip.title: Intellectual Property
ip.content:
All content present on the QoreDB site, including in particular:

* texts,
* documentation,
* blog posts,
* graphic elements,
* visual identity,
* the QoreDB name, logo, and brand,

is protected by copyright and laws relating to intellectual property.

Unless otherwise stated, QoreDB source code is distributed under an **open-core** model:

* a part is published under an open-source license,
* certain advanced features may be subject to a proprietary license.

Any unauthorized reproduction, representation, modification, or exploitation of the protected content or elements is strictly prohibited.

liability.title: Site Access and Liability
liability.content:
QoreDB makes every effort to ensure the accuracy of the information disseminated on the site. However, the project cannot be held responsible for:

* errors or omissions,
* temporary unavailability of the site,
* direct or indirect damages related to the use of the site or software.

Use of QoreDB is under the sole responsibility of the user.

external_links.title: External Links
external_links.content: The QoreDB site may contain links to third-party sites. QoreDB exercises no control over these sites and declines all responsibility regarding their content or practices.

privacy.title: Personal Data
privacy.content:
Personal data management is detailed in the dedicated page:

➡️ [Privacy Policy](/privacy)

QoreDB undertakes to comply with applicable regulations, in particular the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

terms.title: Terms of Use
terms.content:
Use of the QoreDB site, documentation, and software implies full acceptance of the:

➡️ [Terms of Use](#)

license.title: License
license.content:
The license conditions applicable to the QoreDB software are detailed in the dedicated page:

➡️ [License](#)

contact.title: Contact
contact.content: For any legal question, report, or request for information, you can contact the QoreDB team via the official channels indicated on the site.

terms_page.title: Terms of Service
terms_page.intro:
These Terms of Service (hereinafter "ToS") govern the access to and use of the **QoreDB** website, its documentation, its online services, and the QoreDB software.

By accessing the site or using the QoreDB software, the user acknowledges having read these ToS and accepting them without reservation.

definitions.title: 1. Definitions
definitions.content:
* **QoreDB**: refers to the software project, the website, the documentation, the associated tools and services.
* **User**: any person accessing the site or using the QoreDB software.
* **Software**: the QoreDB software, distributed under an open-core model.
* **Site**: the official QoreDB website.

object.title: 2. Object
object.content: The purpose of these ToS is to define the conditions under which users can access the QoreDB site, consult the documentation, use the resources made available, and operate the QoreDB software.

access.title: 3. Access to site and services
access.content:
Access to the QoreDB site is free of charge, unless otherwise indicated.

QoreDB reserves the right to:

* suspend, restrict, or interrupt access to the site or any service,
* modify the content or features offered,
* perform maintenance operations.

No guarantee is given regarding the continuous availability of the site or services.

software_use.title: 4. Use of QoreDB Software
software_use.content:
The QoreDB software is distributed under an **open-core** model:

* a part of the code is published under an open-source license,
* certain features, extensions, or services may be subject to a separate proprietary license.

The precise conditions for use, modification, and distribution of the software are defined in the **QoreDB License**, available on the site and in the official repositories.

user_obligations.title: 5. User Obligations
user_obligations.content:
The user agrees to:

* use QoreDB in accordance with applicable laws and regulations,
* not infringe on the security, integrity, or proper functioning of the site or the software,
* not attempt unauthorized access to systems or data,
* not use QoreDB for fraudulent, illegal, or abusive purposes.

Any abusive use may result in the suspension of access to services.

ip.title: 6. Intellectual Property
ip.content:
All elements of the QoreDB site (texts, documentation, graphics, logo, visual identity) are protected by intellectual property rights.

Unless otherwise stated, any unauthorized reproduction, representation, or exploitation is prohibited.

The source code of the QoreDB software is subject to the terms of the applicable license, as defined in the **License** page.

liability.title: 7. Liability
liability.content:
QoreDB is provided "as is", without warranty of any kind.

QoreDB cannot be held liable for:

* direct or indirect damages resulting from the use of the site or software,
* data loss, business interruption, or commercial damages,
* consequences related to improper configuration or use of the software.

The user is solely responsible for their use of QoreDB and the data they process.

privacy.title: 8. Personal Data
privacy.content: Personal data processing is governed by the **Privacy Policy** accessible on the QoreDB site.

external_links.title: 9. External Links
external_links.content: The QoreDB site may contain links to third-party sites or services. QoreDB exercises no control over these services and declines all responsibility regarding their content or functioning.

updates.title: 10. Changes to ToS
updates.content:
QoreDB reserves the right to modify these ToS at any time.

Users are invited to regularly consult the current version. The date of the last update is indicated at the top of the page.

law.title: 11. Applicable Law
law.content:
These ToS are governed by French law.

In the event of a dispute, and failing amicable resolution, the competent courts will be those of the applicable jurisdiction in accordance with the legislation in force.

contact.title: 12. Contact
contact.content: For any question relating to these Terms of Service, the user can contact the QoreDB team via the official channels indicated on the site.

quick_start_page.title: Quick Start
quick_start_page.description: Browse, query, and manage your data in a few clicks.

install.title: 1. Install and Launch
install.content: Download the latest version from the project's Releases page, install the application, and open it.

connect.title: 2. Create Your First Connection
connect.content:
Click on “+” in the sidebar to add a database:

  • PostgreSQL
  • MySQL
  • MongoDB

Enter the host, port, database, user, and environment (dev/staging/prod).

explore.title: 3. Explore Your Data
explore.content:
Once connected:

  • Navigate through schemas and tables
  • Open a table to visualize data
  • Run SQL queries in the integrated editor

daily.title: 4. Save Time Every Day
daily.content:
• History & favorites to find your queries
  • Global search to move fast
  • Read-only mode to secure production
  • Light/Dark theme and multi-tab interface

security_tip.title: Security Tip
security_tip.content: QoreDB stores your credentials securely via the system's native keychain and supports SSH tunneling.

appendix.title: APPENDIX: How to apply the Apache License to your work

(Don't include the brackets!) The text should be enclosed in the appropriate comment syntax for the file format. We also recommend that a file or class name and description of purpose be included on the same "printed page" as the copyright notice for easier identification within third-party archives.
